title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The Covid-19 pandemic has boosted retirements among baby boomers, further straining the tight labor supply and leaving a hole for employers to fill.

Coca-Cola is buying full control of BodyArmor for $5.6 billion in a deal that values the sports-drink brand at about $8 billion, ramping up a rivalry with Gatorade.

Supermarket chains are revamping their operations to navigate persistent product shortages, expanding storage space and curbing discounts.

Videogame company Roblox suffered an outage Thursday that continued through Sunday afternoon.

Striking workers for Deere are scheduled to vote Tuesday on a contract proposal offering bigger raises and bonuses.

A contraction in China's factory activity worsened for a second straight month in October, adding evidence that growth momentum has weakened.

What's News: Business & Finance
